Installation¶

Basics¶

Install Python for your operating system environemnt. This framework have been tested with latest Python version 2.7.x and Python 3.x versions. It is recommended to use latest Python 3.x for future upgradability and compatibility.

On a command prompt run the following (you may have to run the shell with elevated privelages: run-as-administrator ; sudo -H … ; or other, depending on the OS):

python -m ensurepip --upgrade

Clone Code Repository¶

You should (already) have git client installed on your system. While UI-based clients exist and can be used, it is recommended that git command line is used.

  • Fork this automation project, to your user space:

    http://bitbucket.qumu.com/projects/QA/repos/qe?fork

  • Clone your fork to the local machine:

    git clone --recursive http://<username>@bitbucket.qumu.com/scm/~<username>/qe.git

  • Add reference to the original remote code:

    git remote add upstream http://<username>@bitbucket.qumu.com/scm/qa/qe.git

Note

See Confluence GIT Guide for basic GIT reference and pointers to additional documentation.

Python Virtual Environment¶

Important

Highly recommended - Use python virtual environment.

Install (with elevated privileges) virtualenv, and use it for the reminder of the installation process:

pip install --upgrade virtualenv

and then, activate the virtual environment:

cd <my_qe_automation_project_folder>
virtualenv <my_qe_automation_project_folder>

on Linux / Unix / MAC:

source <my_qe_automation_project_folder>/bin/activate

on Windows:

<my_qe_automation_project_folder>/bin/activate.bat

Note

To exit the virtual environment, run deactivate from the command prompt.

Continue the installation, inside a virtualized environmet and/or with elevated priveleges, and install the following dependencies:

pip install --upgrade -r requirements.txt

Todo

Add video validation installation items.

Highly Recommended & Optional Add-ons¶

  • Interactive python shell:

    pip install --upgrade ptpython

    … and see ptpython website for details about its features. The interactive shell can be used to test the automation code, while providing auto-completion, interactive documentation, and easy introspection of objects.

  • To build documentation:

    pip install --upgrade -r docs/requirements.txt

    … and them run the make file in the docs folder.

  • To generate test report, install allure on supported platforms, per the instructions on the allure website.
